intro: Fornicium carthamoides subsp. orientale, commonly known as the oriental false dandelion, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
